alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Karnes; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 1:27AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Karnes, east central Atascosa and southwestern Wilson Counties through 215 AM CST... At 127 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Campbellton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Floresville, Poth, Kosciusko, Falls City, Cestohowa, Paweleville, Deweesville, and McCoy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
